chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
R: stack nat
P: stack nat

Goal:
sym (P ++ R) = sym P ++ sym R

Premises:
sym = fix sym R : list nat := match R with | [] => [] | (x, y) :: R0 => x ++ y ++ sym R0 end : stack nat -> list nat
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
stack = fun X : Type => list (card X) : Type -> Type Arguments stack _%type_scope
cBPCP : forall (P : stack bool) (u : string bool), derivable P u u -> BPCP P
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
dPCP = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists u : string X, derivable P u u : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments dPCP {X}%type_scope
itau2_app : forall A B : list nat, itau2 ?P (A ++ B) = itau2 ?P A ++ itau2 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- stack ?X]
itau1_app : forall A B : list nat, itau1 ?P (A ++ B) = itau1 ?P A ++ itau1 ?P B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type] ?P : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- stack ?X]
Inductive BPCP (P : stack bool) : Prop := cBPCP : forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> BPCP P
tau2_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau2 (A ++ B) = tau2 A ++ tau2 B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
tau1_app : forall A B : stack ?X, tau1 (A ++ B) = tau1 A ++ tau1 B where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
Ring_polynom.interp_PElist : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
itau2 = fix itau2 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => snd (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau2 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau2 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
itau1 = fix itau1 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => fst (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau1 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau1 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
BPCP_ind : forall (P : stack bool) (P0 : Prop), (forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> P0) -> BPCP P -> P0
BPCP_sind : forall (P : stack bool) (P0 : SProp), (forall u : string bool, derivable P u u -> P0) -> BPCP P -> P0
PCPX = fun (X : Type) (P : stack X) => exists A : list (card X), A <<= P /\ A <> [] /\ tau1 A = tau2 A : forall X : Type, stack X -> Prop Arguments PCPX {X}%type_scope
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
iPCPb = fun P : stack bool => exists A : list nat, (forall a, a el A -> a < | P |) /\ A <> [] /\ itau1 P A = itau2 P A : stack bool -> Prop
Ring_theory.SRsub : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> R -> R
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : string X -> string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
Ring_theory.pow_N_th : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.power_theory rI rmul req Ring_theory.id_phi_N (Ring_theory.pow_N rI rmul)
Ring_theory.pow_N : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.N -> R
derivable_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> SProp), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P [] -> (forall x : A, P [x]) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ [y]) -> P (l ++ [y]) -> P ((l ++ [y]) ++ [x])) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Ring_theory.SRth_ARth : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req
Ring_theory.SReqe_Reqe : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.sring_eq_ext radd rmul req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req
der_cons : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 u v -> derivable P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l)
Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), Forall P []
Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A) (l' : list B), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) l' -> exists l1' l2' : list B, Forall2 R l1 l1' /\ Forall2 R l2 l2' /\ l' = l1' ++ l2'
Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (l1' l2' : list B) (l : list A), Forall2 R l (l1' ++ l2') -> exists l1 l2 : list A, Forall2 R l1 l1' /\ Forall2 R l2 l2' /\ l = l1 ++ l2
Inductive Forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Forall_nil : Forall P [] | Forall_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l) Arguments Forall [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Forall_nil [A]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall_cons [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope
Ring_theory.SRmorph_Rmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul : C -> C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.semi_morph rO rI radd rmul req cO cI cadd cmul ceqb phi -> Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul (Ring_theory.SRsub radd) (Ring_theory.SRopp (R:=R)) req cO cI cadd cmul cadd (fun x : C => x) ceqb phi
der_sing : forall (P0 : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), (x, y) el P0 -> derivable P0 x y where ?X : [P : stack nat R : stack nat |- Type]
Add_ind : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l (a :: l)) -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), Add a l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> forall l l0 : list A, Add a l l0 -> P l l0
Ring_polynom.ring_correct : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe1) (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l pe2)
tau1 = fix tau1 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (x, _) :: A0 => x ++ tau1 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau1 {X}%type_scope
tau2 = fix tau2 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (_, y) :: A0 => y ++ tau2 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau2 {X}%type_scope

original: intros. unfold sym. rewrite fix_eq. reflexivity.
